hackathon-description-text: Hack The Hill is Western Kentucky University's first student-run national hackathon.
hackathon-eligibility: All in-person attendees of Hack The Hill are eligible to submit a hack. Remote submissions will not be considered.
hackathon-rules:
You can utilize open source code so long as it is documented.
Don't use previously written code of your own. Just learn something new and try new things!
Hacks can be software or hardware. We just want to see something creative.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Each member of the winning team will receive an Amazon Echo Dot, and a bluetooth speaker.
Each winner will receive an R/C quadcopter.
Each winner will receive a Google Carboard compatible VR headset.
The winners will receive an Amazon Echo Dot or an Amazon Fire TV stick along with a year of Eezy Premium.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of Vector Graphics by Eezy.com

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Each winner of this prize will receive one year of Developer level status on Wolfram Development Platform, one year of Mathematica license, and one year of Wolfram Alpha Pro.
Best domain name registered with domain.com at Hack The Hill will receive a Domain.com swag bag for each member.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Domain Name Registered with Domain.com

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is your project homegrown, or just a bunch of API calls? We'd like to see your skills.
Is your hack creative, and something we haven't seen? That'll score you some points!
Is your hack useful to someone?

hackathon-description-header: Western Kentucky's first national student hackathon focused on creativity!
